items.title: Trump’s 104% China tariffs hit, US eyes allies
Indonesian gov’t to cut tariff burden by 14% after US hike
items.author: Sri Mulyani
items.summary:
- Indonesia's Finance Minister Sri Mulyani announced a 14% reduction in the tariff burden for businesses.
- This follows a 32% import tariff imposed by the US on Indonesian products.
- The reduction includes a 2% cut from administrative reforms in taxation and customs.
- Income tax on imports will decrease from 2.5% to 0.5%, another reduction of 2%.
- Import duties on certain US products will reduce from 5-10% to 0-5%, adding a further 5% reduction.
- Export tariffs on crude palm oil (CPO) will be decreased, contributing another 5% decrease, aimed to support local businesses.

items.title: ID finance minister criticizes Trump’s tariffs as baseless
items.author: Sri Mulyani Indrawati
items.summary:
- Indonesian Minister of Finance Sri Mulyani Indrawati criticized Trump's tariffs, including a 32% tariff on Indonesia.
- She stated that tariffs lack economic justification and are purely transactional.
- Mulyani warned that unpredictable trade regulations could threaten global economic stability and emphasized the need for strategic management in trade.

items.title: US Hikes China Tariffs to 104% on April 9
items.summary:
- The United States will increase tariffs on Chinese imports to 104% starting April 9.
- This increase follows China's pledge to retaliate against prior US trade actions.
- President Trump had warned of a 50% tariff if China did not drop its planned countermeasures.
- The tariffs mark a significant rise in US protectionism, pushing the average effective tariff rate to 22.5%, the highest since 1909.
- The Yale Budget Lab estimates a 2.3% overall increase in consumer prices, with clothing seeing a 17% hike.
- Economic projections indicate a potential reduction in US GDP by 0.7-0.8%, and job losses could reach approximately 605,000.
- Trade tensions are expected to have broader implications for global supply chains and represent about 43% of global GDP.
- China's retaliation includes the introduction of 34% tariffs on all US imports and controls on critical minerals.

items.title: Shopify CEO tells teams to try AI before adding staff
items.author: Tobi Lütke
items.summary:
- Shopify CEO Tobi Lütke implemented a policy on Apr. 7 requiring teams to justify the need for more staff by explaining how AI cannot perform the required tasks.
- This move reflects a broader trend in the tech industry, where companies are increasingly focusing on AI integration over traditional workforce growth.
- A UN report suggests over 40% of jobs globally could be impacted by AI, with significant job restructuring anticipated rather than outright elimination.
- By 2030, it is projected that 70% of skills in most jobs will change, necessitating adaptation from both employers and workers.
- The policy aims to explore how AI can augment work, emphasizing human-AI collaboration while also requiring a formal justification for expanding teams.

items.title: Ant Digital sets global HQ in Hong Kong
items.summary:
- Ant Digital Technologies will establish its international headquarters in Hong Kong.
- The announcement was made during the OASES Partnership Signing Ceremony.
- The company plans to collaborate with local universities and research institutes to create joint laboratories.
- Ant Digital aims to leverage Hong Kong’s financial ecosystem to enhance Web3 and AI technologies.
- The initiative also focuses on improving digital asset circulation.
- More information is available on the [Ant Digital Technologies website](https://intl.antdigital.com/home).

items.title: 20 largest exits in Japan
items.summary:
- Successful exits are critical for investors, revealing market opportunities.
- This article lists the largest exit transactions in Japan, highlighting challenges in obtaining M&A data.
- Only deals with disclosed values are included; high transaction values may not equate to good shareholder returns.

items.title: Shenzhen EngineAI raises $28m to advance humanoid robotic race
items.summary:
- Shenzhen's EngineAI raised nearly $28 million in a pre-A funding round led by Stone Venture, with contributions from SenseTime's Sense Capital and Honghui Capital.
- Founded in October 2023, EngineAI specializes in humanoid robots, with three models in development, including a 170 cm tall robot capable of advanced movements.
- The funding will enhance their research and development, increase production capacity, and support international expansion.
- The humanoid robot market is expected to grow to $38 billion by 2035, with declining prices likely to drive adoption.
- EngineAI’s SE01 robot is priced similarly to competitors and claims a 10-year operational lifespan, providing potential ROI for businesses.
- The SE01 features bio-inspired movement and technical specifications that position it competitively in the robotics industry.

items.title: Unitree and Great Wall Motor Partner to Develop Robots
items.summary:
• Unitree and Great Wall Motor have partnered to develop robotic technologies.
• The collaboration aims to enhance robotic applications in various industries.
• The partnership follows trends in the automotive industry towards automation and robotics.

items.title: Game studio iCandy launches Web3 gaming chain ZKcandy
items.summary:
- ZKcandy, a Layer-2 blockchain for AI-driven gaming, launched its mainnet on Apr. 7.
- The platform allows users to own and transfer assets across Web3 games.
- During the testnet phase, 2.46 million wallets were created and five games had 230,000 active users.
- ZKcandy has partnered with 19 entities including Layer3, Aethir, and Rarible.
- At launch, it offers eight Web3 games, including Pepe Kingdom and Candy Defense.
- [Source: ZKcandy](https://zkcandy.io/)

items.title: Grab launches AI tools developed with OpenAI, Anthropic
items.summary:
- Grab introduces two AI-driven tools: AI Merchant Assistant and AI Driver Companion.
- AI Merchant Assistant integrated within the GrabMerchant app provides businesses operational insights and sales recommendations.
- With 44 million monthly users across Southeast Asia, Grab partners with OpenAI and Anthropic to train and refine AI models.
- AI Driver Companion predicts high-demand areas and allows drivers to report road conditions verbally.
- Grab’s AI tools reflect a strategic evolution in its expansion beyond ride-hailing to a comprehensive ecosystem.

items.title: Trump’s tariffs: Indonesian ministers to head to US next week
items.author: Airlangga Hartarto, Sugiono, Febrio Kacaribu
items.summary:
- The Indonesian government plans to negotiate a 32% import tariff imposed by President Trump.
- Coordinating Minister Airlangga Hartarto and Foreign Minister Sugiono will lead the delegation.
- The discussions are set to occur after the tariff takes effect on April 9, with the team expected to depart by April 17.
- Indonesia is coordinating with ASEAN nations before discussions with the US.
- Indonesia has a significant trade surplus with the US, making it vulnerable to tariffs based on trade imbalances.
- Key sectors at risk include textiles and footwear, potentially affecting poverty rates and employment.
- Despite challenges, Indonesia has opportunities to become a regional supply chain hub as companies seek alternatives to China.
- Policymakers are exploring deregulation and coordination with ASEAN partners to mitigate negative impacts.

items.title: Startups compete for $1m at Startup World Cup Malaysia 2025
items.summary:
- Startups in Malaysia can apply for the Startup World Cup competition until Apr. 15, 2025.
- The grand prize is a US$1 million investment opportunity at the finals in Silicon Valley.
- The competition includes two chapters: Kuala Lumpur for West Malaysia and Kuching for East Malaysia.
- Winners from each chapter will advance to the global finals with international participation from over 70 countries.
- The event reflects Malaysia's mature startup ecosystem and government support aims to position the country as a regional startup hub.

items.title: SEA’s cleantech ecosystem decoded
Meet the 50 top-funded startups and tech companies in Korea
LG Innotek, Intel team up on AI inspection system
items.summary:
- LG Innotek partners with Intel to implement AI-powered vision inspection solutions to enhance manufacturing processes.
- The AI solution, using Intel’s iGPU, aims for nearly 100% inspection accuracy and reduces AI learning time by 1.5 times.
- The collaboration will expand to LG Innotek’s facilities, including Gumi, North Gyeongsang Province, later this year.
- The AI in manufacturing market is projected to grow significantly, with companies reporting increased revenue and reduced costs from AI implementations.

items.title: Trump team mulls tax credit to ease tariff impact on exporters
items.summary:
- The Trump administration is considering a tax credit for exporters to alleviate pressures from retaliatory tariffs.
- The proposed credit aims to provide a year-end rebate to assist U.S. manufacturers affected by foreign tariffs.
- Congressional approval is needed, and the proposal may also extend to service exporters.
- Divisions have arisen within the administration's economic team regarding the proposal.
- President Trump and Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent have not been briefed on this idea.

items.title: S Korean won hits 16-year low on new US tariff measures
items.summary:
- The South Korean won fell to 1,473.2 won per US dollar on Apr. 8, marking its weakest level since Mar. 13, 2009.
- This decline follows US President Trump's announcement of a 25% duty on South Korean goods and a 10% tariff on foreign imports, effective Apr. 5.
- Country-specific tariffs will take effect on Apr. 9 (US time), raising concerns of continued market volatility and economic impact.

items.title: Affirm, Robinhood, SoFi stocks drop as US tariffs shake fintech
items.summary:
- Shares of fintech firms Affirm and Robinhood have dropped due to new US tariffs announced by President Trump.  
- Affirm's stock decreased by over 21%, Robinhood by 17%, and SoFi by 20% since the announcement on April 2, 2025.  
- Analysts suggest fintech companies are more vulnerable to economic fluctuations compared to traditional banks.  
- Concerns are raised about borrowers’ ability to repay loans, particularly impacting Affirm and SoFi.  
- Affirm reported a 2.5% delinquency rate for loans over 30 days late for Q4 2025, while SoFi reported 0.55% for personal loans over 90 days late.  
- Historical data shows that tariffs negatively affect consumer spending and sentiment, potentially impacting loan repayments.

items.title: Qualcomm, Chinese AI firm DeepRoute.ai develop smart driving tech
items.summary:
- DeepRoute.ai partners with Qualcomm to develop advanced driver assistance systems (ADAS) using Snapdragon platforms.
- The collaboration aims to integrate lidar and vision-only systems for features like urban and highway navigation on autopilot and automated parking.
- This partnership signifies a growing trend of strategic collaborations in the autonomous driving industry to address complexity and enhance technology integration.

items.title: Crypto market cap drops 30% as tariff turmoil hits
items.summary:
- Global cryptocurrency market cap fell to $2.7 trillion, a 30% decline from $3.9 trillion peak in December 2024.
- Decline follows President Trump's tariff announcement on April 2, 2025.
- Bitcoin shows relative stability, decreasing to $78,500 but increasing market dominance to nearly 60%.
- Bitcoin's resilience during market downturns is compared to traditional safe-haven assets.
- Altcoins experience steeper declines as Bitcoin's dominance rises, reflecting market maturity differences.
- Crypto Fear & Greed Index has dropped to 17, indicating extreme fear among investors.

items.title: India pushes AI model localization to prevent data leaks
items.summary:
- The Indian government is considering mandating local storage of AI models to reduce data leak risks.
- The Digital Personal Data Protection (DPDP) Act rules are expected to be finalized by April, aiming to mitigate personal data breaches.
- Concerns raised by Secretary S Krishnan regarding data misuse from foreign AI models, particularly Chinese entities.
- Historical evolution of data localization in India, beginning with payment firms in 2019.
- India has allocated ₹10,300 crore ($1.25 billion) over five years to develop AI infrastructure.
- The importance of AI model localization intertwined with national security and economic strategy.
- Potential risks of limiting globalization for Indian startups and SMEs due to localization restrictions.

items.title: China gov’t urges Shein to halt supply chain shift, sources say
items.summary:
- Chinese authorities have urged Shein to stop diversifying its supply chain by moving some production outside China.
- The Ministry of Commerce contacted Shein to discourage sourcing from other countries ahead of new US tariffs.
- Shein has postponed supplier visits to Vietnam and Southeast Asia due to these developments.
- Tariff exemptions for small parcels from China will end on May 2, raising costs for companies like Shein.
- China's manufacturing hub status is challenged as it works to retain manufacturing jobs while facing high tariffs.

items.title: Not all doom and gloom for SEA agritech
items.summary:
- In February, Vietnamese agritech startup TechCoop secured **US$70 million** in Series A funding, showing investor confidence in agritech despite previous scandals.
- TechCoop projects an annual revenue of **US$250 million** by **2025** and claims to be already profitable.
- There's a trend where some investors are optimistic about the agritech sector despite broader skepticism.
- The article also discusses healthtech advances in the UAE, particularly a startup named BioSapien developing **3D-printed medichips** for chemotherapy, with clinical trials expected to start in **February**.

items.title: Chinese AI firm AICT plans $200m IPO
items.author: Yan Jun
items.summary:
- Beijing-based AI company AICT aims to raise at least US$200 million through an IPO in Hong Kong.
- The company specializes in AI-powered traffic control and parking solutions used in over 50 cities in mainland China.
- AICT plans to submit its listing application to the Hong Kong stock exchange by the end of April 2025.

items.title: 50 rising startups in Korea
items.summary:
[Startups in Korea are raising new funding rounds, indicating their potential for growth.]
[The list features companies up to the series E stage, with details on their funding rounds.]
[Access to the comprehensive database of tech companies in Asia is available for deeper insights.]

items.title: German defense tech firm faces criticized for high-priced drones
items.summary:
- Helsing is a Munich-based defense tech startup valued at over €5 billion (US$5.48 billion), facing scrutiny for high-priced drones and software performance issues.
- Founded in 2021, its drones have been used in Ukraine since 2022, and criticisms have been made regarding their targeting system.
- The firm claims its technology evolves with battlefield needs and emphasizes the importance of confidentiality.
- Collaboration with Rheinmetall AG is ending in 2024 without reaching technical development, but Helsing maintains ongoing partnerships with Saab.
- Recently secured a €40 million (US$43.88 million) contract for Lithuania’s border security and is involved in Germany’s Eurofighter program.
- Employing over 400 people, Helsing aims to be a key player in software-defined military solutions.

items.title: IBM debuts new system with AI, enhanced security
items.summary:
- IBM has launched the z17 mainframe to manage AI models alongside customer data.
- Enhanced security developed with HashiCorp, marking the first mainframe update since 2022.
- Mainframes give customers greater control over their data compared to cloud systems.
- IBM expects modest growth in its physical infrastructure segment, which earned US$14 billion last year.
- The mainframe market is projected to grow to $2.9 billion by 2025, defying predictions of decline.
- The z17 supports AI workloads, reflecting a trend toward leveraging existing data infrastructures.
- Companies are increasingly focused on data ownership and security in their computing strategies.

items.title: EU Commission to impose 25% tariff on US goods in May
items.summary:
- The European Commission will impose a 25% tariff on certain US goods starting May 16, with additional tariffs on December 1.
- Tariffs will affect products like diamonds, eggs, poultry, almonds, and soybeans, while bourbon, wine, and dairy were removed to lessen economic impact.
- EU countries will vote on the proposal on April 9, with existing steel and aluminum import restrictions already in place.

items.title: Stellaris leads $3.5m seed round of Indian apparel startup
items.author: Nirmal Jain, Mani Kant Mani, Justin Mario
items.summary:
- Indian D2C apparel startup Outzidr raises ₹30 crore (US$3.5 million) in seed funding.
- Funding round led by Stellaris Venture Partners, with participation from eight angel investors.
- Funds to enhance business model, product design, marketing, and inventory management.
- Outzidr was founded in 2024 and focuses on western and party wear for women aged 17 to 27.
- Launched in February 2025, selling through its D2C platform and on Myntra, Nykaa Fashion, and Ajio.
- Aims for an annual revenue run rate of ₹100 crore (US$11.64 million) by end of 2025, competing with brands like FS Life and Berrylush.

items.title: Japan’s Nikkei index surges 6% as tech, banks lead gains
items.summary:
- Japan's Nikkei index rose 6% on Apr. 8, following a 1.5-year low in the previous session.
- The index reached 32,959.59, with tech stocks like Tokyo Electron up 8.85% and Advantest up 11%.
- All 33 sub-indexes closed higher, with the banking sector leading at 11% gains.

items.title: HK Web3 Festival opens despite volatile crypto markets
items.summary:
- The Hong Kong Web3 Festival commenced on Apr. 7, 2025, amidst significant market volatility and a sharp decline in cryptocurrency prices.
- Bitcoin fell to approximately US$77,000, marking a nearly 30% decrease from its January peak of over US$109,000.
- The festival is organized by HashKey Group and Wanxiang Blockchain Labs, and features Hong Kong's Financial Secretary Paul Chan Mo-po emphasizing the city's commitment to Web3 development and balancing regulation with innovation.

items.title: White House orders agencies to appoint chief AI officers
items.summary:
- The White House Office of Management and Budget (OMB) announced on Apr. 7 that federal agencies must appoint chief AI officers to enhance responsible AI use in government operations.
- Agencies are required to apply risk management standards and develop a Generative AI policy, replacing a previous AI policy from 2024.
- This directive reflects ongoing shifts in U.S. federal AI governance with different administrations while consistently prioritizing American leadership in AI.

items.title: Play Ventures leads $13.3m series B for Indian social gaming platform
items.summary:
- EloElo raised 114.3 crore rupees (US$13.3 million) in series B funding, led by Play Ventures Investments.
- The investment included 1,696 series B shares priced at 6.73 rupees (US$0.078) each.
- Following this round, key ownership stakes include Kalaari Capital (6.35%), Play Ventures (3.38%), and Courtside Ventures (4.46%).
- EloElo's focus on live streaming and interactive gaming aligns with market trends that favor creator-led live content.
- The platform reported INR 99.06 crore in losses for FY24, reflecting high cash burn typical in the Indian social media landscape.
- The funding comes amid significant consolidation in India's social media sector, with platforms striving to diversify revenue streams.

items.title: Airtree leads $4.5m series A in Sydney AI firm Gridsight
items.summary:
- Gridsight, a Sydney-based software company, secured AU$7.5 million (US$4.5 million) in series A funding led by Airtree Ventures.
- Other investors include Energy Transition Ventures, Aera VC, and Pat Cummins.
- Funds will be used for expansion and product development of Gridsight’s AI-powered platform, focusing on renewable energy integration.
- Gridsight collaborates with 50% of Australia’s grid operators, analyzing data from 4.2 gigawatts of distributed energy resources.
- The company aims to support renewable energy adoption and reduce household electricity costs.
- Recently partnered with Endeavour Energy, implementing an AI program to double rooftop solar export capacity, enough to offset energy consumption for 75,000 homes.

items.title: Broadcom announces $10b share buyback
items.summary:
- Broadcom has initiated a share buyback program of up to $10 billion, effective until December 31.
- Following the announcement, Broadcom's shares rose by 3% during late trading.
- The buyback comes after a 34% decline in the company’s stock this year due to tech sector volatility.
- CEO Hock Tan emphasized that the buyback reflects board confidence in the company's chip and infrastructure software business.
- The move is seen as strategic amid significant volatility in semiconductor stocks due to tariff concerns.
- Broadcom continues to balance aggressive shareholder returns with investments in artificial intelligence (AI).
- The company reported AI revenue of $4.1 billion in the most recent quarter, a 77% year-over-year increase.
- Broadcom is positioned as a competitor to Nvidia in the AI chip market, showing a trend toward custom hardware solutions.

items.title: Pakistani fintech firm Haball secures $52m pre-series A
Anthropic to create over 100 new jobs in Europe
items.summary:
- Anthropic will create over 100 new positions in Europe, focused in its Dublin and London offices.
- Guillaume Princen has been appointed as the head of operations in Europe, the Middle East, and Africa.
- New roles will include positions in sales, engineering, research, and business operations.
- This move aligns with Europe's AI Champions Initiative, a €150 billion investment to boost AI adoption.
- Anthropic’s expansion targets specialized AI talents and compliance with the EU's regulations.
- AI adoption is rapidly increasing across industries in Europe, with an emphasis on enterprise-level integration.

items.title: Goldman Sachs sees 45% US recession risk
items.summary:
- Goldman Sachs raises US recession probability to 45% within 12 months, up from 35%.
- Change attributed to President Trump’s new tariffs affecting the economy.
- Key factors include tightened financial conditions, decline in foreign tourism, and increased policy uncertainty.

items.title: US lawmakers probe Zuckerberg over Meta’s China efforts
items.summary:
- US lawmakers are investigating Mark Zuckerberg over allegations he misled Congress about Meta's attempts to enter the Chinese market.
- The inquiry was initiated by Senator Josh Hawley following claims from former employee Sarah Wynn-Williams' memoir, "Careless People."
- Allegations include that Meta supported Chinese censorship and provided AI tools against dissidents.
- Meta denies wrongdoing, stating it ceased its interest in China in 2019 and does not operate there.

items.title: Luckin Coffee partners Stripe for Malaysia, Singapore expansion
items.summary:
- Luckin Coffee collaborates with Stripe to expand into Singapore and Malaysia.
- Partnership allows for a localized cross-border payment system for diverse payment preferences in Southeast Asia.
- Integration completed in one month, supporting payments via GrabPay, PayNow, FPX, and Apple Pay.
- Luckin Coffee's model focuses on technology and convenience, aiming to replicate its success in China in Southeast Asia.
- Southeast Asian specialty coffee market valued at $4.4 billion, with 8% projected growth through 2028.
- Stripe's infrastructure enables rapid compliance and payment optimization essential for international expansion.

items.title: Indonesian air quality tech firm said to net nearly $3m
items.summary:
- Nafas, an Indonesian air quality management firm, is finalizing a funding round worth nearly $3 million.
- The funding involves investment from Rigel Capital and Qatar Development Bank (QDB).
- Co-founder Piotr Jakubowski confirmed the news to DailySocial but did not provide further details.
- Nafas has recently expanded to the Middle East, opening a regional hub in Doha, Qatar.
- The firm aims to tackle air quality issues using technology in offices and educational institutions.
- The funding round highlights the growing recognition of air quality technology as an important investment sector.

items.title: Latin American ecommerce giant to invest $5.8b in Brazil
Apple stock drops 19%, loses $638b as tariffs threaten iPhones
Meta denies manipulation of AI benchmark with Llama 4 models
Amazon upgrades Nova Reel AI video model
Marvell Technology sells auto ethernet unit to Infineon for $2.5b
Asia Economic Summit
All eyes on Fore as IPO gives 1st sip of cafe startup listings
items.summary:
- Fore Coffee's IPO occurs in a challenging market environment with Indonesia's stock market at its lowest since 2021.
- The company's $24 million target is modest compared to competitors like Kopi Kenangan.
- Fore Coffee's success could influence future IPOs in the coffee startup sector, shifting traditional funding methods in Indonesia.

items.title: Samsung’s $4.5b Q1 profit outpaces forecasts despite setback
items.summary:
- Samsung Electronics reported a preliminary operating profit of 6.6 trillion won (US$4.5 billion) for Q1 2025, exceeding expectations.
- The profit surge is attributed to strong demand for Galaxy S25 smartphones and existing DRAM products.
- Samsung faces challenges in the high-bandwidth memory (HBM) segment, lagging behind competitors like SK Hynix.
- The company plans to launch new HBM3E and HBM4 chips later this year despite tighter US chip export rules impacting sales in China.
- Analysts note that unusual customer stockpiling amid geopolitical tensions contributed to Samsung's Q1 performance.
- Samsung has segmented a critical share of its HBM sales to Chinese customers, which are now threatened by export restrictions.
- Samsung's successful Galaxy S25 launch helped stabilize revenues despite declines in DRAM and NAND flash prices.
- The company's quarterly revenue rose approximately 10% to 79 trillion won due to robust smartphone sales, but analysts warn of declining market growth ahead.
